solution.text:
Both have identical principal (P) = Rs. _{{5000*j}}_
Interest Rate annually (R)= _{k}_ %
Time period (T) = 3 years
Amount due by Abha = P + SI =\( P + (P \times R \times T/100) \)= Rs. _{{(5000*j+150*j*k)}}_
Amount due by Megha, \( A= P \times (1 + (R/100))^T \)= Rs. _{{5000*j*(((100+Decimal(k))/100)**3)}}_
Therefore, since amount due by Megha is greater than that due by Abha,
\( \Rightarrow \) Difference in amount = Megha's amount - Abha's amount = _{{(5000*j*(((100+Decimal(k))/100)**3))}}_ - _{{(5000*j +150*j*k)}}_ = Rs._{{(5000*j*((100+Decimal(k))/100)**3)- (5000*j +150*j*k)}}_

content.text: Two friends Abha and Megha, take loans for identical amounts of Rs. _{{5000*j}}_ at identical interest rates of _{k}_ % annually. Abha's bank offers only simple interest while Megha's bank offers only compound interest. What is the difference in the amount they have to repay, if they both repay the loan in 3 years?
